subject: Economics
title: Platform Competition: Winner-Take-All in Tech
description: One-minute skill: Platform Competition: Winner-Take-All in Tech.

hook.text: Facebook has 3 billion users not because it's the best social network, but because everyone else is already on it.

buildup.text: Network effects: a product becomes more valuable as more people use it.

discovery.text: Platforms compete by solving a coordination game: users join the platform where other users are.

twist.text: This creates a paradox: the dominant platform doesn't need to be the best â€” just the most popular.

climax.text: Tech platform competition is a real-world coordination game with billions of players.

punchline.text: In platform markets, the best product often loses to the most popular one.

quiz.question: Why do platform markets tend toward winner-take-all outcomes?
options: Network effects make platforms more valuable as they grow, making it nearly impossible for smaller competitors to catch up
Only one company can build a platform
